Back to Franz Schubert

Franz Schubert

Sonata in F minor, D 625

1818

[Wikipedia] · [IMSLP page 1] · [IMSLP page 2]

Total duration: 23'

  • 1. Allegro
  • Adagio in D-flat major, D 505
  • 2. Scherzo: Allegretto
  • 3. Allegro

The sonata is missing a slow movement. This is often taken to be the adagio in D-flat major (D 505).

Recommended editions

  • Neue Schubert-Ausgabe (Bärenreiter) · VII/2/2 · BA 5541 · Klaviersonaten II · ed. Walburga Litschauer [including D 505]
  • Associated Board · Complete Pianoforte Sonatas / Volume II · ed. Howard Ferguson [including D 505]
  • Henle · HN 150 · Klaviersonaten / Band III · ed. Paul Mies [with completion by Paul Badura-Skoda, including also D 505]
  • Henle · HN 151 · Klaviersonaten / Band III · ed. Paul Mies [with completion by Paul Badura-Skoda, including also D 505]
  • Wiener Urtext · UT 50221 · Sämtliche Klaviersonaten / Band 2 · ed. Martino Tirimo [with completion by Martino Tirimo, including also D 505]

1. Allegro

This movement is incomplete.

Duration: 7' 30"

Difficulty: 3

Adagio in D-flat major, D 505

Duration: 4'

Difficulty: 2.5

2. Scherzo: Allegretto

Duration: 5' 30"

Difficulty: 3

3. Allegro

This movement is incomplete.

Duration: 6'

Difficulty: 3.5
